Reviewing or Modifying Task Properties

If you have the required security privileges, you can review and edit many task properties. When you change the properties of a task or subtask, you should also enter a comment to explain why the modifications were required.

Note: The Task Properties dialog displays ten tabs. Many fields are controlled via the StarTeam Microsoft Project Integration and cannot be edited.

To review or modify task properties:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click the Task tab on the upper pane. This action displays a tree or list of existing tasks in the upper pane.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Double-click a task or subtask in the task tree or list.

    • Select a task or subtask, then select Properties from the Task menu or the context menu.

    The Task Properties dialog opens.

  4. Select any of the available tabs, and review or edit the task properties.

  5. When your edits are complete, select the Comment tab, and explain the reason for your changes.

  6. Click OK. StarTeam then creates a new revision of the task.

Task Properties Dialog

Task tab

  • Subtask Of: Displays the name of the parent of this task. It is blank if the task is the root of a task tree. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, this field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Name: Displays the name of this task. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, this field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Responsibility: Indicates which team member has final responsibility for the completion of the task. This field is editable. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, this field is initially set to the user named as a resource who has the lowest User ID.

  • Status: Indicate where a task is in the process of completion. This field is editable. The values for this field are:

    • Pending: The task is waiting on the completion or start of a predecessor task and cannot be started. This is the default value for new tasks.

    • Ready to Start: This task may be started, as all predecessor tasks have been completed.

    • In Progress: Work has been entered for this task.

    • Finished: The task has been finished, according to the team members working on the task.

    • Closed: The task has been completed to the satisfaction of the team leader or task reviewer. Depending on the policy of the team, users may be permitted to change tasks to this status value instead of using the intermediate status of Finished.

    • Hold: While this task could have work performed for it, based on the state of its predecessor tasks, it has been placed on hold due to other scheduling issues.

    For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, this field is set to In Progress when work is added or to Finished when all the work has been completed. It can be edited.

  • Duration: When a task has no subtasks, this field indicates the length of time (in hours) that the task is expected to take. When a task has subtasks, Duration equals the amount of time from the start of the earliest subtask to the completion of the latest subtask. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, this field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Milestone: In Microsoft Project, a milestone is a type of task that represents a significant landmark, development, or turning point in the life of a scheduled project. A milestone is usually defined by entering a task name and assigning it a duration of zero. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, this field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Priority: Indicates the relative priority of the task. The values are Highest, Very High, Higher, High, Medium (the default), Low, Lower, Very Low, and Lowest. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, this field is maintained by StarTeam Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Percent Complete: The percentage of the task that has been completed. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, this field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Needs Attention: StarTeam check box and text box that allow you to indicate that this task needs special attention from other people. Information about the problem is entered in the text box. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, you can edit this field.

Resources tab

Task resource assignments: List of the users who will work on this task. Do not edit this field for Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam.

Project Plan tab

Only tasks that have been exported from Microsoft Project have the Project Plan tab.

  • Task type: Task types are Fixed Duration, Fixed Units, and Fixed Work. See Microsoft Project documentation for details. This field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • WBS code: A work breakdown structure code as defined in the Microsoft Project documentation. This field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Type (constraint): Indicates how urgent a task is. The possible values are As Late As Possible, As Soon As Possible (the default), Finish No Earlier Than, Finish No Later Than, Must Finish On, Must Start On, Start No Earlier Than, and Start No Later Than. This field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Date (constraint): The date that accompanies any of the Type (constraint) values, with the exception of As Late As Possible and As Soon As Possible. This field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Replicated in project plan: This check box defaults to selected and is disabled for all tasks except the task at the root of a task tree. Its purpose is to allow you to delete a task tree that has been deleted from the Microsoft Project file. The StarTeam Microsoft Project Integration deletes subtasks for you, but does not recognize the deletion of an entire task tree. The check box should be cleared in this situation or when a connection to Microsoft Project is no longer possible or desired (for example, the Microsoft Project files have been lost). Then you can delete these tasks if desired.

  • Project plan path: The complete path to the Microsoft Project file from which these tasks were exported. This field is maintained by StarTeam Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Unique ID: The unique task ID generated by Microsoft Project. This field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Last updated: The date and time at which this task information was last updated by the Microsoft Project Integration. This field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

Time tab

  • Start (planned): Estimated start date for this task.

  • Finish (planned): Estimated finish date for this task.

  • Work (planned): Estimated number of hours for this task.

  • Start (actual): Actual start date for this task.

  • Finish (actual): Actual finish date for this task.

  • Work (actual): Actual number of hours for this task.

  • Start (variance): Number of days between the estimated and the actual start date. When the estimated start date has passed and the task has not been started, this field displays the number of days from the estimated start date to the present date.

  • Finish (variance): The number of days between the estimated and the actual finish date. When the estimated finish date has passed and the task has not been finished, this field displays the number of days from the estimated finish date to the present date.

  • Work (variance): The difference between the number of hours allowed for the work and the number of hours done.

For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, all of these fields are maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

Work tab

  • Work records: List of work records added from StarTeam. You can click Add, Edit, or Delete to change the list of work records. The field is editable. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, this field can be edited by using the Microsoft Project Integration and by the StarTeam Task component.

  • Total actual work: Total number of hours recorded in work records. This is totaled by StarTeam from the work records. This field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration for Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam.

Dependencies tab

Only tasks that have been exported from Microsoft Project have the Dependencies tab.

  • Predecessors: The list of tasks that this task depends upon. A task cannot be started or completed until its predecessor tasks are completed. This field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

  • Successors: The list of tasks that cannot be started or completed until the current task is completed. This field is maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

Notes tab

  • Notes: Information about the task. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, the contents of this field are maintained by the Microsoft Project Integration.

Custom tab

The Custom tab may contain any number of custom fields created by your team or administrator. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, you can edit these fields.

Attachments tab

  • Attachments: You can add files as attachments to the task by clicking Add. You can also remove a current attachment by clicking Remove or save an attachment to a location on your workstation or rename it by using Save As. For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, you can edit this field.

Comment tab

For Microsoft Project tasks that have been exported to StarTeam, you can edit the Comment fields.

  • Comment for this revision: This field displays revision comments for the revision you are reviewing. Revision comments are entered in StarTeam by team members. This field is editable from the History tab.

  • Comment for the new revision: If you modify at least one of the task properties, StarTeam creates a new revision of the task when you click OK. It is recommended that you explain in this text box why you made these changes.
